comments: The p=10 member of the p-family of sequences {(n+p-1)!/p!}, n >= 1.The asymptotic expansion of the higher order exponential integral E(x,m=1,n=11) ~ exp(-x)/x*(1 - 11/x + 132/x^2 - 1716/x^3 + 24024/x^4 - 360360/x^5 + 5765760/x^6 - ...) leads to the sequence given above. See A163931 and A130534 for more information. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Oct 20 2009a(n) = A173333(n+10,10). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 19 2010a(n) = A245334(n+10,n) / 11. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 31 2014
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
prog: (MAGMA) [Factorial(n+10)/3628800: n in [0..25]]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Jul 20 2011(Haskell)a051431 = (flip div 3628800) . a000142 . (+ 10)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 31 2014
author: _Wolfdieter Lang_
